00045 // the entry point for any Windows program
00046 int WINAPI WinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance,HINSTANCE hPrevInstance,LPSTR lpCmdLine,int nCmdShow) {
00047         // the handle for the window, filled by a function
00048         HWND hWnd;
00049         // this struct holds information for the window class
00050         WNDCLASSEX wc;
00051 
00052         // clear out the window class for use
00053         ZeroMemory(&wc, sizeof(WNDCLASSEX));
00054 
00055         // fill in the struct with the needed information
00056         wc.cbSize = sizeof(WNDCLASSEX);
00057         wc.style = CS_HREDRAW | CS_VREDRAW;
00058         wc.lpfnWndProc = WindowProc;
00059         wc.hInstance = hInstance;
00060         wc.hCursor = LoadCursor(NULL, IDC_ARROW);
00061         // wc.hbrBackground = (HBRUSH)COLOR_WINDOW;
00062         string lpszClassNameStr = "WindowClass1";
00063         string windowNameStr = "3DVision Test";
00064         wc.lpszClassName = lpszClassNameStr.c_str();
00065 
00066         // register the window class
00067         RegisterClassEx(&wc);
00068 
00069         // create the window and use the result as the handle
00070         hWnd = CreateWindowEx(NULL,
00071                 lpszClassNameStr.c_str(),// name of the window class
00072                 windowNameStr.c_str(), // title of the window
00073                 WS_EX_TOPMOST | WS_POPUP,// fullscreen values
00074                 0,// x-position of the window
00075                 0,// y-position of the window
00076                 gImageWidth,// width of the window
00077                 gImageHeight,// height of the window
00078                 NULL,// we have no parent window, NULL
00079                 NULL,// we aren't using menus, NULL
00080                 hInstance,// application handle
00081                 NULL);// used with multiple windows, NULL
00082 
00083         // display the window on the screen
00084         ShowWindow(hWnd, nCmdShow);
00085 
00086         // set up and initialize Direct3D
00087         initD3D(hWnd);
00088 
00089         //3D VISION
00090         // create the surface
00091         d3ddev->CreateOffscreenPlainSurface(gImageWidth *2, gImageHeight + 1, D3DFMT_A8R8G8B8, D3DPOOL_DEFAULT, &gImageSrc, NULL);
00092 
00093 
00094         fout.open("result.txt");
00095         MyTimer timerIns;
00096         timerIns.Start();
00097         LONGLONG _start = timerIns.getElapsedTime();
00098         LONGLONG _current;
00099         int frameToRender;
00100         int lastRenderedFrame = -1;
00101         bool buffered = false;
00102         int counter = 0;        // rendered frames counter
00103         int bufcounter = 0;     // loaded frames counter
00104 
00105         // Lock the stereo image
00106         D3DLOCKED_RECT lr;
00107         gImageSrc->LockRect(&lr,NULL,0);
00108         // write stereo signature in the last raw of the stereo image
00109         LPNVSTEREOIMAGEHEADER pSIH = (LPNVSTEREOIMAGEHEADER)(((unsigned char *) lr.pBits) + (lr.Pitch * (gImageHeight)));
00110 
00111         // Update the signature header values
00112         pSIH->dwSignature = NVSTEREO_IMAGE_SIGNATURE;
00113         pSIH->dwBPP = 32;
00114         //pSIH->dwFlags = SIH_SWAP_EYES; // Src image has left on left and right on right, thats why this flag is not needed.
00115         pSIH->dwWidth = gImageWidth*2;
00116         pSIH->dwHeight = gImageHeight;
00117 
00118         // Unlock surface
00119         gImageSrc->UnlockRect();
00120 
00121         // enter the main loop:
00122 
00123         // this struct holds Windows event messages
00124         MSG msg;
00125 
00126         while(TRUE) {
00127                 // wait for the next message in the queue, store the result in 'msg'
00128                 while(PeekMessage(&msg, NULL, 0, 0, PM_REMOVE)) {
00129                         // translate keystroke messages into the right format
00130                         TranslateMessage(&msg);
00131 
00132                         // send the message to the WindowProc function
00133                         DispatchMessage(&msg);
00134                 }
00135 
00136                 // If the message is WM_QUIT, exit the while loop
00137                 if(msg.message == WM_QUIT)
00138                         break;
00139 
00140                 _current = timerIns.getElapsedTime() - _start;
00141                 frameToRender = (int)(_current * fps / (double)1000000);
00142                 //frameToRender = frameToRender % 3 + 400;
00143                 //if (counter>250)
00144                 //{
00145                 //      break;
00146                 //}
00147                 if(frameToRender + 1 > totalFrames) {
00148                         //switch to another demo
00149                         if(demo == 2){
00150                                 prefixL = prefixL3;
00151                                 prefixR = prefixR3;
00152                                 totalFrames = totalFrames3;
00153                                 demo = 3;
00154                         }
00155                         else if(demo == 3){
00156                                 prefixL = prefixL1;
00157                                 prefixR = prefixR1;
00158                                 totalFrames = totalFrames1;
00159                                 demo = 1;
00160                         }
00161                         else if(demo == 1){
00162                                 prefixL = prefixL2;
00163                                 prefixR = prefixR2;
00164                                 totalFrames = totalFrames2;
00165                                 demo = 2;
00166                         }
00167                         _start = timerIns.getElapsedTime(); // start over
00168                         continue;
00169                         break;
00170                 }
00171                 if(buffered==false) {
00172                         getFilename(lastRenderedFrame+1);
00173                         loadFrame(lastRenderedFrame+1);
00174                         //configureSurface();
00175                         bufcounter++;
00176                         buffered=true;
00177                 }
00178                 if(frameToRender!=lastRenderedFrame) {
00179                         //fout<<"rendering frame "<<frameToRender<<endl;
00180                         render_frame();
00181                         counter++;
00182                         lastRenderedFrame = frameToRender;
00183                         buffered = false;
00184                 }
00185         }
00186 
00187         // clean up DirectX and COM
00188 
00189         fout<< "total frames buffered = "<<bufcounter<<endl;
00190         fout<< "total frames rendered = "<<counter<<endl;
00191         double perf = (double)counter * 1000000/ timerIns.getElapsedTime();
00192         fout << "actual fps reached = "<< perf << endl;
00193         fout.close();
00194         // return this part of the WM_QUIT message to Windows
00195         cleanD3D();
00196         return msg.wParam;
00197 }

00200 // this is the main message handler for the program
00201 LRESULT CALLBACK WindowProc(HWND hWnd, UINT message, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam) {
00202         // sort through and find what code to run for the message given
00203         switch(message) {
00204                 // this message is read when the window is closed
00205 case WM_DESTROY: {
00206         // close the application entirely
00207         PostQuitMessage(0);
00208         return 0;
00209                                  }
00210                                  break;
00211         }
00212 
00213         // Handle any messages the switch statement didn't
00214         return DefWindowProc (hWnd, message, wParam, lParam);
00215 }

00217 // this function initializes and prepares Direct3D for use
00218 void initD3D(HWND hWnd) {
00219         d3d = Direct3DCreate9(D3D_SDK_VERSION);// create the Direct3D interface
00220 
00221         D3DPRESENT_PARAMETERS d3dpp;// create a struct to hold various device information
00222 
00223         ZeroMemory(&d3dpp, sizeof(d3dpp));// clear out the struct for use
00224         d3dpp.Windowed = FALSE;// program fullscreen
00225         d3dpp.SwapEffect = D3DSWAPEFFECT_DISCARD;// discard old frames
00226         d3dpp.hDeviceWindow = hWnd;// set the window to be used by Direct3D
00227         d3dpp.BackBufferFormat = D3DFMT_A8R8G8B8;// set the back buffer format to 32 bit
00228         d3dpp.BackBufferWidth = gImageWidth;
00229         d3dpp.BackBufferHeight = gImageHeight;
00230         d3dpp.PresentationInterval = D3DPRESENT_INTERVAL_ONE;
00231         d3dpp.BackBufferCount = 1;
00232 
00233         // create a device class using this information and information from the d3dpp struct
00234         d3d->CreateDevice(D3DADAPTER_DEFAULT,D3DDEVTYPE_HAL,hWnd,D3DCREATE_SOFTWARE_VERTEXPROCESSING,&d3dpp,&d3ddev);
00235 }
00236 
00237 // this is the function used to render a single frame
00238 void render_frame(void) {
00239         // clear the window to a deep blue
00240         d3ddev->Clear(0, NULL, D3DCLEAR_TARGET, D3DCOLOR_XRGB(0, 40, 100), 1.0f, 0);
00241 
00242         d3ddev->BeginScene();// begins the 3D scene
00243 
00244         // do 3D rendering on the back buffer here
00245         render3D();
00246 
00247 
00248         d3ddev->EndScene();// ends the 3D scene
00249 
00250         d3ddev->Present(NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);// displays the created frame
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00254 // this is the function that cleans up Direct3D and COM
00255 void cleanD3D(void) {
00256         d3ddev->Release();// close and release the 3D device
00257         d3d->Release();// close and release Direct3D
00258 }
00259 
00260 
00261 // this is the function that combines two images.
00262 void render3D(void) {
00263         // set destRect
00264         destRect.left = 0;
00265         destRect.top = 0;
00266         destRect.bottom = gImageHeight;
00267         destRect.right = gImageWidth;
00268 
00269         // Get the Backbuffer then Stretch the Surface on it.
00270         d3ddev->GetBackBuffer(0, 0, D3DBACKBUFFER_TYPE_MONO, &gBackBuf);
00271         d3ddev->StretchRect(gImageSrc, NULL, gBackBuf, &destRect, D3DTEXF_NONE);
00272 }
00273 
00274 wstring s2ws(const string& s) {
00275         int len;
00276         int slength = (int)s.length() + 1;
00277         len = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, s.c_str(), slength, 0, 0);
00278         wchar_t* buf = new wchar_t[len];
00279         MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, s.c_str(), slength, buf, len);
00280         wstring r(buf);
00281         delete[] buf;
00282         return r;
00283 }

00285 void getFilename(int _frame) {
00286         stringstream filenamer;
00287 
00288         filenamer<<prefixL<<setw(4)<<setfill('0')<<_frame<<suffix;
00289         //filenamer<<prefixL<<_frame<<suffix;
00290         filenamer>>filenameStrL;
00291         filenameWstrL = s2ws(filenameStrL);
00292 
00293         filenamer.clear();
00294         filenamer<<prefixR<<setw(4)<<setfill('0')<<_frame<<suffix;
00295         //filenamer<<prefixR<<_frame<<suffix;
00296         filenamer>>filenameStrR;
00297         filenamer.clear();
00298         filenameWstrR = s2ws(filenameStrR);
00299 
00300         filenameL = filenameWstrL.c_str();
00301         filenameR = filenameWstrR.c_str();
00302         filenameLL = filenameStrL.c_str();
00303         filenameRR = filenameStrR.c_str();
00304 }
